active_alerts.title: Bowdoin Escalator 125 (Lobby to street) is unavailable until further notice.
active_alerts.description:
The escalator will remain out of service for the foreseeable future. This decision was made after a thorough inspection determined that corrosion on the escalator’s steel truss was so severe that it could not be repaired further and that a complete replacement of the escalator would be required. Replacing the escalator at this location requires a more extended unit meeting modern escalator safety requirements. This longer unit will require significant alteration to the station entrance to meet code requirements. The MBTA has currently begun design work to understand what station upgrades will be needed. 
  
Due to these complexities, we expect the escalator will remain out of service for a significant time. We recognize the challenges this poses to our riders, and please know we are working to identify a solution as quickly as possible. In the meantime, Government Center Station, which is fully accessible and serves the Blue Line, is under a quarter-mile from Bowdoin Station.

active_alerts.title: Green Ln D: Shuttle buses are replacing service between Riverside & Kenmore through Oct 31 for track & infrastructure work
active_alerts.description:
Express Shuttles:
Shuttle buses will make all stops between Riverside and Newton Highlands and then run express to Copley.

Local Shuttles:
Shuttle buses will make all stops between Riverside and Kenmore except Beaconsfield. 

Accessible Van:
A van will be able to take riders between Beaconsfield, Dean Rd, Washington Sq & Reservoir stations.

Travel Time:
Riders using shuttles should allow for ample extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to Government Center from Riverside should budget at least an additional 30 – 45 minutes.

Free Bluebikes Access:
During this closure, the City of Boston is offering a promotion code for up to five free Bluebikes unlocks, MBTAGREEN1024.

Shuttle Stop Locations:

Riverside:
Riverside Station

Woodland:
Eastbound & Westbound - Woodland Station

Waban:
Eastbound - Beacon St @ Waban Station
Westbound - Beacon St opp Waban Station (1651 Beacon St)

Eliot:
Eastbound - Lincoln St @ Woodward St (170 Lincoln St)
Westbound - Lincoln St @ Woodward St (173 Lincoln St)

Newton Highlands:
Eastbound - Walnut St @ Lincoln St (Officer English Park)
Westbound - Walnut St @ Floral St  (1170 Walnut St)

Newton Centre:
Eastbound - Langley Rd @ Braeland Ave
Westbound - Langley Rd opp Braeland Ave (80 Langley Rd)

Chestnut Hill:
Eastbound - Boylston St @ Hammond St (1182 Boylston St)
Westbound - Boylston St @ Hammond St

Reservoir:
Eastbound & Westbound - Reservoir Station

Beaconsfield:
Due to narrow roads near Beaconsfield, shuttles cannot safely stop there. Riders can take the Green Line C Branch from Dean Road, about a 4 minute walk. An accessible van will also be available to take riders to Reservoir and Washington Sq.

Brookline Hills:
Eastbound - Boylston St @ Cypress St (308 Boylston St)
Westbound - Boylston St @ Cypress St (365 Boylston St)

Brookline Village:
Eastbound - Brookline Ave @ Pearl St
Westbound - Pearl St @ Brookline Village (10 Brookline Pl)

Longwood:
Eastbound - Brookline Ave @ Longwood Ave (330 Brookline Ave)
Westbound - Brookline Ave @ Longwood Ave (429 Brookline Ave)

Fenway:
Eastbound & Westbound - Park Dr @ Fenway Station

Kenmore:
Eastbound & Westbound - 512 Commonwealth Ave

Copley:
Eastbound - Boylston St @ Dartmouth St
Westbound - Boylston St @ Clarendon St

active_alerts.title: Jackson Sq: The stairway connecting the lobby & the south end of the platform is closed. Use the stairway at the north end of the platform.
Malden Center Escalator 312 (Street level to Commuter Rail platform) unavailable due to maintenance.
There is no accessible path connecting the inb. & outb. platforms at Wellesley Sq Sta. The existing path includes steep slopes & is long.
active_alerts.description: There are accessible mini-high platforms at the Western end of both the Track 1 and Track 2 sides. However, the existing pedestrian path between the two sides is long and includes steep slopes, especially on the Crest Road bridge over the tracks. Designs are underway to provide for a fully compliant pathway.

active_alerts.title: Littleton/Route 495 passengers can expect occasional traffic and detours accessing the station due to the Foster Street reconstruction work
active_alerts.description: Scheduled to complete sometime in 2027, the Reconstruction of Foster Street includes widening and resurfacing with the addition of bicycle lanes.

active_alerts.title: Roxbury Crossing Elevator 847 (Platform to paid lobby) unavailable due to maintenance
active_alerts.description: A shuttle bus will be available to transport customers between Roxbury Crossing and Ruggles. To exit, exit the train at Ruggles and find station personnel or use a station call box to request the shuttle bus to Roxbury Crossing. To board, find station personnel or use a station call box at Roxbury Crossing to request the shuttle bus to Ruggles. Alternatively, customers may also use Bus Route 22 for transportation between Roxbury Crossing and Ruggles.

active_alerts.title: Chinatown Elev. 876 will be unavailable from Mon Sep 22 through Mon Nov 3 for major equipment upgrades
active_alerts.description:
The elevator will be closed for work that will significantly improve its long-term reliability.

To Exit:
Take an Oak Grove Train to Downtown Crossing; then take Downtown Crossing elevator 891 to Franklin Street. At Franklin Street customers should turn left and travel 450 feet south on Washington Street then take Downtown Crossing elevator 892 to the Forest Hills platform. Then take a Forest Hills Train to Chinatown and use elevator 922 to exit the station.

To Board:
Go to Chinatown Elevator 922 on Essex St. Take Elevator 922 to the Forest Hills platform. Take a Forest Hills train to Tufts Medical Center. Transfer to an Oak Grove train.
